text.textPath: "German literature is a rich tapestry of intellectual depth, emotional intensity, and cultural reflection. From the epic tales of the Nibelungenlied to the philosophical works of Goethe and Schiller, it explores themes of individuality, freedom, and the human condition. The Romantic era brought profound lyricism, while writers like Thomas Mann and Franz Kafka delved into modern existential struggles. German literature has consistently pushed boundaries, blending philosophy, art, and storytelling to create works that challenge, inspire, and endure across generations."
